title: ICE: failed to lookup `SourceFile` in new context

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code I am not able to narrow down the error, sadly. The project is simply too big for me to figure out what's going on, but if it helps the exact commit on which this error happens is https://github.com/Andy-Python-Programmer/aero/commit/023649f2b516f863e88af9b789e675f1f5581915. For some additional information please look at https://github.com/Andy-Python-Programmer/aero/issues/20, it explains the issue more in-depth and I also went ahead and tried to narrow it down to specific rustc commits (2nd reply in the issue). ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.59.0-nightly (e100ec5bc 2021-12-21) binary: rustc commit-hash: e100ec5bc7cd768ec17d75448b29c9ab4a39272b commit-date: 2021-12-21 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.59.0-nightly LLVM version: 13.0.0 ``` ### Error output ``` error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.59.0-nightly (e100ec5bc 2021-12-21) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu note: compiler flags: -Z unstable-options -C embed-bitcode=no -C debuginfo=2 -C incremental -C force-frame-pointers=yes --crate-type bin note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden query stack during panic: #0 [type_of] computing type of `fs::cache::CacheIndex::unused` #1 [check_private_in_public] checking for private elements in public interfaces #2 [analysis] running analysis passes on this crate end of query stack ```
Backtrace

``` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'failed to lookup `SourceFile` in new context', compiler/rustc_query_impl/src/on_disk_cache.rs:500:22 stack backtrace: 0: rust_begin_unwind at /rustc/e100ec5bc7cd768ec17d75448b29c9ab4a39272b/library/std/src/panicking.rs:498:5 1: core::panicking::panic_fmt at /rustc/e100ec5bc7cd768ec17d75448b29c9ab4a39272b/library/core/src/panicking.rs:107:14 2: core::panicking::panic_display at /rustc/e100ec5bc7cd768ec17d75448b29c9ab4a39272b/library/core/src/panicking.rs:63:5 3: core::option::expect_failed at /rustc/e100ec5bc7cd768ec17d75448b29c9ab4a39272b/library/core/src/option.rs:1819:5 4: >::decode 5: >::decode 6: ::read_seq::, as rustc_serialize::serialize::Decodable>::decode::{closure#0}> 7: >::decode 8: >::decode 9: <&rustc_middle::ty::TyS as rustc_serialize::serialize::Decodable>::decode 10: as core::iter::traits::collect::Extend>::extend::, <&rustc_middle::ty::list::List as rustc_serialize::serialize::Decodable>::decode::{closure#0}>, alloc::string::String>> 11: as rustc_middle::ty::context::InternIteratorElement>>::intern_with::, <&rustc_middle::ty::list::List as rustc_serialize::serialize::Decodable>::decode::{closure#0}>, ::mk_substs, <&rustc_middle::ty::list::List as rustc_serialize::serialize::Decodable>::decode::{closure#0}>>::{closure#0}> 12: >::decode 13: <&rustc_middle::ty::TyS as rustc_serialize::serialize::Decodable>::decode 14: as rustc_middle::ty::context::InternIteratorElement>>::intern_with::, <&rustc_middle::ty::list::List as rustc_serialize::serialize::Decodable>::decode::{closure#0}>, ::mk_substs, <&rustc_middle::ty::list::List as rustc_serialize::serialize::Decodable>::decode::{closure#0}>>::{closure#0}> 15: >::decode 16: <&rustc_middle::ty::TyS as rustc_serialize::serialize::Decodable>::decode 17: <&rustc_middle::ty::TyS as rustc_serialize::serialize::Decodable>::decode 18: ::read_map::>, > as rustc_serialize::serialize::Decodable>::decode::{closure#0}> 19: >::decode::{closure#0} 20: ::try_load_query_result::<&rustc_middle::ty::context::TypeckResults> 21: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::try_load_from_disk_and_cache_in_memory:: 22: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::try_execute_query::> 23: ::typeck 24: ::typeck_body 25: rustc_hir::intravisit::walk_impl_item:: 26: rustc_passes::dead::check_crate 27: as core::ops::function::FnOnce<()>>::call_once 28: as core::ops::function::FnOnce<()>>::call_once 29: ::time::<(), rustc_interface::passes::analysis::{closure#5}> 30: rustc_interface::passes::analysis 31: >::with_task::> 32: rustc_data_structures::stack::ensure_sufficient_stack::<(core::result::Result<(), rustc_errors::ErrorReported>, rustc_query_system::dep_graph::graph::DepNodeIndex), rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::execute_job>::{closure#3}> 33: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::try_execute_query::>> 34: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::get_query:: 35: ::enter::> 36: ::enter::, rustc_errors::ErrorReported>> 37: rustc_span::with_source_map::, rustc_interface::interface::create_compiler_and_run, rustc_driver::run_compiler::{closure#1}>::{closure#1}> 38: >::set::, rustc_driver::run_compiler::{closure#1}>::{closure#0}, core::result::Result<(), rustc_errors::ErrorReported>>::{closure#0}::{closure#0}, core::result::Result<(), rustc_errors::ErrorReported>> note: Some details are omitted, run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=full` for a verbose backtrace. ```
